articles.description: SEATTLE -- Are you one who can boast doing a good job at keeping your New Year's resolutions? Seems like you're not alone if you're in the Seattle area. A new report by WalletHub named the Emerald City No. 3 in the nation at keeping their New Year's resolutio…

articles.title: Why Solar Energy Stocks Can Beat the Market Again in 2021 - Motley Fool
articles.description: Solar energy stocks may still have room to run.
articles.content: Solar energy stocks have had a great year in 2020, despite a global pandemic that slowed sales and installations mid-year. Shares of SunPower(NASDAQ:SPWR), Sunrun(NASDAQ:RUN), Enphase Energy(NASDAQ:E… [+4780 chars]

articles.author: Dara Bitler
articles.title: What is Level Orange? Here’s what you need to know about the downgraded restrictions - FOX 31 Denver
articles.description: Colorado Governor Jared Polis announced last week that the state will adjust its COVID-19 dial framework starting Monday, allowing all counties in Level Red to move to Level Orange following a steady decline of COVID-19 cases.
articles.content: DENVER (KDVR) — Colorado Governor Jared Polis announced last week that the state will adjust its COVID-19 dial framework starting Monday, allowing all counties in Level Red to move to Level Orange fo… [+2962 chars]

articles.title: Insurer Centene to buy Magellan in a $2.2 billion mental health push - CNBC
articles.description: Health insurer Centene said on Monday it would buy Magellan Health in a deal valued at $2.2 billion, including debt.
articles.content: Health insurer Centene said on Monday it would buy Magellan Health in a $2.2 billion deal, looking to build up its mental health services as more Americans struggle with Covid-19-related behavioral a… [+1685 chars]

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: China's factory sector rose in December, sustained pre-Covid levels - Fox Business
articles.description: Activity in China’s factory sector rose in December as the world’s second-largest economy sustained its recovery to pre-pandemic levels, a business survey showed on Monday, however, increasing cost pressures slowed the pace of expansion.
